item.title: UP experts'new projection: 330k to 375k COVID-19 cases by Sept. 30
item.description: The number of COVID-19 cases in the Philippine may rise to up to 375,000 by the end of September, according to the newest projection made by experts from the University of the Philippines.

item.title: Locsin to recommend termination of contracts with Chinese companies involved in South China Sea island reclamation
item.description: “If I find that any of those companies are doing business with us then I would strongly recommend we terminate that relationship with that company,” Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. said Friday.

item.title: 16 arrested, 'illegally detained' family rescued in QC operation --NBI
item.description: The National Bureau of Investigation has arrested 16 people fover allegations they illegally detained a family, including a 6-year-old boy, in a compound in Quezon City for more than a month.

item.title: Number of COVID-19 cases in Philippines stabilizes but no significant decrease yet
item.description: “Hindi na ganun kataas…nagstabilize lang ang number of cases, pero hindi pa significant ang pagbaba ng kaso,” Dr. Rontgene Solante of San Lazaro Hospital said in an interview over Dobol B sa News TV.

item.title: Remulla: No need to probe Zoom sex scandal, involved execs have resigned
item.description: Cavite Governor Jonvic Remulla on Friday said there is no need to probe the alleged Zoom sex scandal involving barangay officials in Dasmariñas City, Cavite as both officials have already quit from their respective posts.

item.title: Remulla says cash aid a 'disaster' in Cavite, hopes MSME assistance under Bayanihan 2 is better
item.description: Cavite Governor Jonvic Remulla is hoping that assistance for micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) under the Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or Bayanihan 2 is better compared to the aid provided by the national government under the first Bayanihan law.

item.title: Angara: Online hearings won t compromise Senate delibs on 2021 fighting budget
item.description: "We will be thorough in our review for that has always been the Senate way. We will not sacrifice scrutiny for speed," Senator Sonny Angara said in a statement. "Hindi rin po hadlang ang online hearings sa masusi at masinsinan na pagrerepaso ng mga panukalang budget ng mga ahensya," he added.

item.title: Cash-out fee should not be more than P50, cash aid beneficiaries told
item.description: Beneficiaries of the government's emergency cash aid program who had deductions greater than P50 from payout centers are encouraged to coordinate with the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD).

item.title: COVID-19 vaccine clinical trials for Cavite residents to start in two weeks -Remulla
item.description: The clinical trials for vaccines against COVID-19 involving Cavite residents would begin in the next two weeks, Governor Jonvic Remulla said Friday.

item.title: Pakikipagkuwentuhan sa oras ng lunch, bawal na sa mga empleyado ng LGU Kalibo
item.description: KALIBO, Aklan --Dahil sa patuloy na banta ng COVID-19 pandemic sa lalawigan ng Aklan, ipinagbabawal muna ng Municipal Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office ang pakikipagkuwentuhan lalo na sa panahon ng lunch time sa lahat ng departamento na sakop ng bayan ng Kalibo.

item.title: UN rights body urged to launch probe mechanism on alleged abuses in Philippines
item.description: Over 60 civil society organizations on Thursday appealed to the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) to immediately launch an independent investigation mechanism on alleged human rights abuses in the Philippines under the Duterte administration.

item.title: Trump to accept Republican nomination with warning of chaos
item.description: President Donald Trump accepts the Republican Party nomination for reelection Thursday against storm clouds of racial tension, riots and the coronavirus pandemic -- while warning of "chaos" should he lose to Democrat Joe Biden.

item.title: North Korea's Kim says Typhoon Bavi caused little damage - report
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said Typhoon Bavi had caused only minimal damage to the country after making landfall early on Thursday, state news media KCNA reported on Friday.

item.title: Senior Chinese diplomat Wang Yi casts doubt on coronavirus originating in China
item.description: The Chinese government's top diplomat, State Councillor Wang Yi, said on Thursday it was unclear whether the corona virus had first originated in China, casting doubt on the views of health experts and foreign governments.

item.title: Hurricane Laura slams Louisiana, kills four, but less damage than forecast
item.description: Hurricane Laura ripped through Louisiana on Thursday, destroying buildings in towns across the southwestern corner of the state and killing four people who were crushed by falling trees as they sheltered in their homes, officials said.
